remarks: The "continuous at a point" predicate when the range is given by a basis for a topology.  (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 3-Feb-2015.)  (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 22-Aug-2015.)
statement:
tgcn.1 $e |- ( ph -> J e. ( TopOn ` X ) ) $.
tgcn.3 $e |- ( ph -> K = ( topGen ` B ) ) $.
tgcn.4 $e |- ( ph -> K e. ( TopOn ` Y ) ) $.
tgcnp.5 $e |- ( ph -> P e. X ) $.
tgcnp $p |- ( ph -> ( F e. ( ( J CnP K ) ` P ) <-> ( F : X --> Y /\ A. y e. B ( ( F ` P ) e. y -> E. x e. J ( P e. x /\ ( F " x ) C_ y ) ) ) ) ) $.
$d B x y $.
$d F x y $.
$d J x y $.
$d K x y $.
$d P x y $.
$d X x y $.
$d Y x y $.
$d ph x $.
